medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until she was 11 months 12 days of age, when intermittent vomiting developed, diagnosed as viral gastroenteritis. After two months of intermittent vomiting episodes lasting 3-5 days, associated with lethargy and decreased oral intake, a pediatric gastroenterologist investigated possible causes. Three weeks before the current admission, formula was changed to a soy-based formula. On the day of admission, she experienced four episodes of vomiting in the evening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had mild facial eczema but no known allergies or medications. No relevant chronic illnesses or surgeries were specified.
medical_history.family_history: Father had gallstones and pancreatitis, paternal grandmother had gallstones, paternal grandfather had colon cancer and diabetes mellitus, maternal grandfather had arthritis, and a distant paternal cousin had Crohnâ€™s disease. There was no family history of celiac disease.
